explanation: A Sundial, Hourglass, Pendulum (a core component of many clocks), and Chronometer are all devices used for measuring or keeping track of time. A Compass, however, is an instrument used for navigation and indicating direction.

Watling Street, Fosse Way, Ermine Street, and Peddars Way are all significant Roman roads located in ancient Britannia (Great Britain). The Appian Way (Via Appia) is a famous Roman road, but it is located in Italy.
Knife (silent 'K'), Gnome (silent 'G'), Debt (silent 'B'), and Hour (silent 'H') all contain a silent letter. Clock does not have a silent letter.
